subject: Replace body_file with class to call uwsgi.chunked_read()

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.

Patch Set 1:

I got this 502 error when I deploy glance with stable pike. The upper requirements for Webob in Pike is 1.7.3. So I think we should cherry-pick this.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Clean cherry-pick.  Withholding +1 pending answer to devstack dependency question.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This is important to allow us to move towards running all of our services under UWSGI.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

I'm fine with backporting this it's self contained and should be low risk and enables using glance under uwsgi on pike.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the response, Mr. T.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I do not think we should backport any of the uwsgi changes and give perception that glance would work under uwsgi.

There is too many current issues with that (none of the tasks run with uwsgi, if workers set to 40+ it breaks[0] and I'm likely missing some others from the list).

We're currently stronly advising not to run Glance under uwsgi and thus I don't think it's appropriate to backport some of these fixes to stable branch unless we get to the point where we can confidently say that it works.

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/637738/

Patch Set 1:

@Erno so your objection to backporting this is that the tasks api doesn't work with uwsgi (which is bug, but honestly very few people use). That's something I hope to have time to investigate and fix in the near future. But I don't think that alone is a reason not to backport this, because there are lots of users out there who don't care about tasks but do care about deploying with uwsgi.

Your synthetic example doesn't actually contain sufficient details to understand what's going on. I also tried to reproduce it locally and it worked fine with procs set to 40. While misconfiguring the server like that did bog down my little vm (mostly because of ram exhaustion)  it didn't cause any 500s on glance calls. I think the 500 you're getting there is likely caused by some other issue that was introduced at the same time of the restart. (which is likely why it persists across the config revert) But without actually showing the stack trace in the logs I can't tell.

Also, where is it documented that "We're currently stronly advising not to run Glance under uwsgi" because that's not the impression most people get. It's used for upstream testing on every patch which is quite visible. There is a a strong desire to use this in deployments because it makes a lot of things better and easier (which is why this backport has been proposed). Personally I think as long as you don't care about the tasks API there is nothing wrong with using uwsgi. This backport just enables people to do that instead of waiting for queens.

Patch Set 1:

Deployer input:

We're moving more towards running every thing inside uwsgi and there is a common goal in OpenStack to do that.  In addition, the documentation leads to say that it is possible

https://docs.openstack.org/glance/pike/admin/apache-httpd.html#uwsgi

The *first* paragraph starts off with:

"uwsgi
This is the current recommended way to deploy Glance with a real web server."

This is against what is being brought up in the review, also, I believe that this backport does not impact users who are not using uwsgi.  So there is only good that can come out of it (fixing something which is claimed to be supported by the application).

If the tasks API is not working, then it would be a bug that would have to be fixed (and backported IMHO, because Glance was released with "uwsgi is the production server" so anything that affects that should be a bug).

I understand the resources or time to put into resolving this aren't always there, but at least this can move us forward in the right direction.  We have been running Glance with this patch in production for all our public and private clouds under UWSGI with no issues (we don't use the tasks API).  The cloud is quite busy and it hasn't missed a beat.

Patch Set 1:

This isn't my patch. I did write the commit on master originally, but I had nothing to do with the backport. (which is why I'm not listed as the review owner in gerrit) I didn't even see this review until someone pinged me on irc about it last week. I reviewed this with my stable hat on just like reviewing any other proposed backport and I think it fits the criteria for backport to pike and that's why I'm +2 on it.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

We're also in the process of deploying Pike and moving towards uWSGI for all API services. This patch fixed issues we were having when uploading images.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

Just wanted to address this:

> If the tasks API is not working, then it would be a bug that would have to be fixed (and backported IMHO, because Glance was released with "uwsgi is the production server" so anything that affects that should be a bug).

Glance was explicitly NOT release with "uwsgi is the production server".  Please see the "Known Issues" section of the Pike release notes: https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/glance/pike.html#known-issues

Patch Set 1: Workflow-1 Code-Review-2

I want to make sure this does not merge until we have a chance to discuss this at the PTG.  I share Erno's concern about giving people the impression that we are fully supporting running glance under uwsgi unless we are committed to doing so.  Apparently the statement in the Pike release notes is being overlooked by a lot of people.  I've added a statement to the Queens release notes, but that will probably be overlooked by just as many people.
Removed Workflow-1 by Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Patch Set 1:

notice Brian has a patch in devstack to stop deploying
Glance under uwsgi: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545483/

Maybe we can cherry pick it to stable/pike and queens. Then this patch can be abandoned.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Abandoned

Abandon now. Better to stop supporting uwsgi for Glance in devstack in Q, P

Patch Set 1:

After seeing the comment from mtreinish on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545483/ I think this was prematurely abandoned

Patch Set 1:

@Eric B: My understanding of the PTG discussion is that the Glance team does not endorse efforts to patch glance in the stable branches so that it can be run in a configuration that is not recommended by the Glance team for production use, and which only fixes the problem for some use cases.

Patch Set 1:

Yes indeed, the discussion in PTG was that we do not want to give the perception that we would be supporting Glance ran in WSGI containers on any current stable branches.

We obviously will not block any fixes to master trying to get us there, but we are not going to backport changes for this feature when it's clearly advised not to deploy Glance for production in this way.

Patch Set 1:

I understand you're position, but the problem with it is that it ignores that real people are using this already, whether it's the recommendation or not. Even if you ignore the people who have commented here and/or left a +1 vote, this is still the way that devstack deploys glance, and the way that OSA deploys from pike. That's a lot of users. This is why I'm being pinged by an increasing number of people every few days about this issue. The longer we wait the more people are going to keep asking about this. By refusing to backport this fix (which by the way is self contained and doesn't effect anything unless you run under uwsgi) you're forcing all of those users to do this out of band (which makes everyone's life more difficult), and makes pike as it sits today unusable for a large number of people. Quite frankly this seems like it should outweigh any implied recommendation for use by easily fixing a bug for all those users. It also doesn't change any of the big statements you have in the docs about the limitations of using uwsgi, since the async tasks support hasn't been fixed yet. Well except for maybe the last one: "If the ability to run Glance under uWSGI is important to you, feel free to participate in the Glance community to help coordinate and drive such an effort." which is exactly what this backport is. This kind of backport should honestly be table stakes for a stable branch, I'd be hard pressed to think of a more straightforward example that fits the stable policy.
